content.description: The crux on Udači is the start and first move.
content.location:
Udači is located on the large sloped edge in he center of the boulder. 

  The start holds are a small RH undercling crimp under the sloped edge and a LH crimp in the center of the sloped edge up top. From there you need to go straight up. Use whatever methods you need to on the start, but avoid moving too far left or right. The route is straight up, which makes it quite challenging.

content.description: The crux of this climb is in the beginning with the start. The first move of the problem is a dyno sideways off a pinch to a large sloped edge. Too much swing or improper foot placement could result in minor injuries.
content.location:
Drunken Monkey is located in the center of the boulder where there is a chest height, large, sloped edge with a small overhang above it. 

  The start is about 2-3 feet to the right of that on a large pinch which is a 2-hand start hold. From there you work your way left, go up, work your way right, and go up for a top-out.

content.description: The rock quality on this boulder is very nice, but there are sections of sharp rock here and there. This boulder is also visible from the road through the park.
